name: Matrix Pooling
description:
# Pooling

Given a matrix, kernel size and function, walk on the matrix by using kernel size and apply the function over submatrix.

![alt text](https://miro.medium.com/max/792/1*uoWYsCV5vBU8SHFPAPao-w.gif)

# TASK

We have a function called 'pooling' which arguments are matrix, kernel and function.
Apply the pooling process on the given matrix and return the new matrix.

## Example

```
matrix = [
  [6, 4, 3, 6, 8, 3], 
  [4, 3, 7, 1, 1, 3], 
  [1, 3, 4, 3, 2, 9], 
  [1, 5, 8, 1, 7, 2], 
  [4, 8, 0, 8, 6, 0], 
  [6, 2, 5, 3, 9, 1]
]
```

```
kernel = (2,2) #(width, height)
fn = maximum
```

After pooling process

```
result = [
  [6, 7, 7, 8, 8], 
  [4, 7, 7, 3, 9], 
  [5, 8, 8, 7, 9], 
  [8, 8, 8, 8, 7], 
  [8, 8, 8, 9, 9]
]
```
